messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 752
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 00-08-31 15:50:53 EDT, you write:  erin, where can i get these 2
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 00-08-31 15:50:53 EDT, you write:

<<
journals. i use creative memories journal pages and permanent pens >>
erin,
where can i get these 2 items? i feel as if their baby/childhood is slipping
away!!!!!!!!
bridget

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 752
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/31/00 6:08:45 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/31/00 6:08:45 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< a series of books by the Giselle
Institute,
Your one year old, your two year old and so on >>

just wanted to second these books. they really have helped me occasionally
in the past when i could read them and realize not only the range of normalcy
for the age appropriate behavior, but also learn a little about the WHY
behind what was happening with the kid.
erin

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 752
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/31/00 6:08:45 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/31/00 6:08:45 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< I think a journal for each would be in order. What a great gift but
instead
of for their wedding I think on the birth of their first child!!!
>>

this is great, i do it for my kids, i jot notes into the empty spaces on my
daily calendar, then about once every coupla months i transfer to their
journals. i use creative memories journal pages and permanent pens for
longevity... ive only been doing it for two years and already it is fun,
interesting and helpful too to go back and see who was doing what and when!
erin
